data.title: Warm and cozy atmosphere..delicious food
data.text: We sat at the bar as we waited for friends to arrive..bartenders were helpful in discussing wines and letting us sample before choosing. Nice atmosphere, especially loved the pizza oven and open kitchen! Our server was attentive and took good care of us. Ordered the mussels appetizer which was delicious and flavorful, but some were gritty. We split a pizza which was good, but a bit expensive for size ($15) when you compare to other equally delicious pizzas in GR. I think we would come back to try other dishes...

data.title: Delicious Downtown GR Dining Option
data.text: Osteria Rossa has to be the best option for Italian food in the downtown GR area. The food is superb, however the food is a slight bit on the spendy side ($25+ entrée), and the entrée portions are not huge (not enough to split). Quality and taste are 100% there. This is a perfect date night sport or casual dining option for entertaining business clients. Overall a Very Good rating, just short of excellent due to portion size for the price. Thank you Osteria Rossa for expanding GR's culinary scene.

data.title: Unique Place
data.text: Came here while visiting Grand Rapids.  Was made to feel very welcome by my server.  Liked the atmosphere and the décor of the restaurant.  Ordered the Clams and Linguini.  Sauce was different from what I'm used to in a clam sauce, but it was good.  Had almost a citrus taste to it.  The noodles were overcooked to my liking, but I prefer my pasta cooked al dente.  Would consider going here again if in the area but would order something different.

data.title: Very nice food
data.text: We found the restaurant to be very good with good quality of food and very friendly and helpful staff.

data.title: Not much for the price
data.text: We ate here on a Saturday night.  The menu was limited, even though it was printed on a large sheet of paper!  The pasta was salty - and not in a good way.  The portions small.  We ordered mussels - on the dinner menu - not the small plates - and only had 5 mussels and the rest was pasta.  Service was only fair.

data.title: Meatball Paradise but try the Octopus Salas and the Rigatoni Rocks!
data.text:
It was raining, everybody was talking about the weather. So a business traveler we asked some locals where's a good place to eat?  They said Follow us . Found ourselves at Osteria Rossa, it was crowded so we took seats at the bar.  Great view watching them prepare the food and to get a good idea of what to order.

Try the Octopus Salad!  The best I've  had outside of Italy.  Just the right amount of spice, but that's how I like my meatballs too.  The knowledgeable bartender recommended the Rigatoni.  I added a meatball because they looked so awesome.  Check out the pics!

data.title: Great dinner at the bar
data.text: I stumbled into this restaurant while dining on my own as I was in town on business. Everything is locally sourced and handmade. The atmosphere is comfortable, and the bartender offered excellent selections. The spaghetti with clam sauce was fresh & original. The pasta was clearly made in house. The recommended wine was a perfect pairing, as I am unfamiliar with the most Italian varietals. I also had homemade pistachio gelato for dessert that was outstanding. Was only sorry that I could not return before I left town.

data.title: Great Italian food!
data.text: My wife and I visited for our anniversary.  We had the mussels as an appetizer - absolutely the best I have ever had-worth the trip by itself!  The entrees were delicious as well and the service was top notch.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: I really enjoyed my pasta with fava beans and greens. It was very light and summer-y. The beans were quite flavorful and the pasta was well made. Nice ambiance to the place.

data.title: Under delivered on expectations.
data.text:
Was excited to visit a good Italian restaurant. Great location downtown. We went with a group of friends and had reservations. We were seated and grabbed a couple of bottles of wine. Our server was a bit confused on the wines as to which were sweeter, ect... 
We ordered our apps and enjoyed those.
When the main dishes arrived, we were surprised by the lack of quality of the spaghetti dish. For an Italian restaurant, you probably shouldn't overcook the noodles. whooops! 
We also ordered the chicken, which was just ok. Lacked salt and a tad under seasoned. The squash pizza was a favorite amongst the group. It was very good with the addition of the goat cheese, dill, and lemon. 
It was not air conditioned, so it made a hot summer day, even hotter and uncomfortable. They opened the windows and doors, but it was equally hot outside. 
Checks came and went. 
Overall, I had high hopes because I had heard good things about this restaurant and I love Italian food, however for the price, I will not be going back any time soon when there are so many other high quality venues to choose from around town.

data.title: Excellent atmosphere with some very good dishes
data.text: We've had some excellent dishes here (the Rigatoni Bolognese and the Chicken) and some that are just okay (the pizzas and spaghetti). While we like it, we do not go often as we think the menu items are a bit overpriced.

data.title: Large group
data.text: 12 of us had reservations and were seated at a long table. We enjoyed a variety of appetizers and main dishes. Everyone complimented their food and drinks. Our waitress did an amazing job in attending to each of our needs.

data.title: Always dissapointed
data.text: This is a neighborhood restaurant I really want to like....but they disappointment me every time I have frequent it.  They do not serve California wines , Michigan yuck and sort, I was served martini only 2/3's full, and bar is limited alcoholic selection, not much premium offerings.  Suppose to have Italian food, but never traditional.  I just ordered capris salad and came with hard crunchy mozzarella and chunks of tomatoes versus the classic way ....sliced and homemade mozzarella slices of cheese!  Really why change the Italian traditional salad.  I would suggest going to a different restaurant for traditional Italian food.... They are not!

data.title: Great food; Great location
data.text: We were looking to get a meal before a musical at Civic Theater and Osteria Rossa definitely gave us what we were looking for and the food was great! We had a very helpful server and the meal and drinks were very satisfying.  I would recommend for anyone looking to have a nice environment for good fun and spending time with friends.

data.title: Terrific new Italian bistro
data.text:
Low light, romantic ambiance, terrific happy hour specials, and awesome food make Osteria Rossa a great find in an area swimming in food & drink options.

Pasta right from your Italian grandmother's table.  Cheers!

data.title: It was OK
data.text: Lovely location in downtown Grand Rapids; however, there is more to a restaurant than location.  The food/wine was great, but a server can make it or break it.....and I guess we got the latter.

data.title: Outstanding food
data.text: I was unsure how their food would taste based on the menu selection, even though this place came highly recommended because of their food. Let me tell you that it does not disappoint in the least! I had a Chardonnay (delicious) the octopus as a starter (wonderful flavor and great sharing dish for two) and the Agnolotti Pasta (such a great flavor.) I also now highly suggest this place.

data.title: Best restaurant in Grand Rapids
data.text: This progressive Italian cuisine is mind blowingly good. All made from scratch and ingredients found locally. The proof is in the flavor. It helps that Chef Perkey is one of the best in town. I could eat a whole trough of the octopus appetizer. There is such a massive difference in taste between Osteria and places like Carabas or Macoroni grill. This is what Italian should taste like. Very reasonably priced for the quality of the fare too. If in GR, this place is a must!

data.title: Italian food, local ingredients
data.text: This newly opened Italian restaurant is perfect for special occasions or just a romantic dinner for two. My husband and I visited in January for his birthday and went all out—ordering drinks, appetizers, entrees, and desert and coffee—and still didn't go over $100. And with local, Michigan ingredients, Osteria Rossa makes Italian food look easy. A must-visit.

data.title: Late night, great food
data.text:
Staying in Grand Rapids for a recruiting trip.....Finished the recruiting late, but got in without any problems.  What a great dining experience!  The staff is also friendly and professional.

Had a 1/2 portion of spicy pasta that was just fabulous.  Finished dinner with tiramisu that was as good as you would find at any upscale restaurant.  My friend had the octopus salad and a pizza that was also fabulous.

If you have not yet dined here, just go and try it.  You will probably make it a regular visit.  I will be recruiting every year in Grand Rapids and will return many times.
